results.title: Young job seekers package
results.brief_description: Consists of six programmes designed to help young people in the search for work. The segments are titled as follows:- Your first job interview, Preparation, Presentation, Answering questions, Showing initiative, and Improving performance. The program also provides comments from the employers point of view re each applicant. No other credits available.

results.title: Young Hands
results.creator_credit: W.H. Shepard, John Appleton and John Martin-Jones
results.brief_description:
Essentially an adverisement for the Juniour Farmer’s Organisation, focusing on how members and the community benefit from it. Stars ‘Hal’, a young man who must continue to run his family’s farm while his father is ill.

Follows Hal and other junior farmers members as they complete various ‘projects’ such as raising lambs, preserving fruit and growing crops. Strong social element within the organisation is exemplified by a social dance that is used to bookend Hal’s story.

Very earnest piece. Amusing end scene.

results.title: Young hands
results.creator_credit: Dept of the Interior, Australian National Film Board, John Martin-Jones and W. H. Shepherd
results.brief_description: Depicts the activities of Young Farmers Clubs in Australia. Two students from Pakistan and Indonesia, visit the club meeting, learn the aims of the club and see how the group functions.

results.title: Young Frankenstein (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Greskoff, Venture, Crossbow, Michael Greskoff and Mel Brooks
results.brief_description: Mel Brooks takes Mary Shelley’s classic horror story and adds elements of Yiddish theatre, burlesque and camp to create an hilarious send-up of the horror movie genre. Featuring an array of star comic performances (including Cloris Leachman, Marty Feldman, Kenneth Mars), “Young Frankenstein” is considered by some to be director Mel Brooks’ best film. Gene Wilder stars as the grandson of the original Dr. Frankenstein who travels back to an absurd Transylvania to uncover his grandfather’s hideous secrets.

results.title: Young fingers on a typewriter: a new concept in learning
results.creator_credit: University of California, Los Angeles, Les Thomsen Productions and Grace Petitclerc
results.brief_description:
Shows how children aged between six to twelve developed their typing skill, at the same time advancing in lateral dominance, self image, spelling, reading and storywriting.
Suitable for tertiary/teacher level.

results.title: Young film makers
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Eugene Schlusser
results.brief_description: A grade 6 class at Kananook Primary School show how they made a film. During a visit to ABC Channel 2 they learned about make-up, back drops and costumes. After long discussion the script was worked out, actors chosen, props and costumes made and locations chosen.

results.title: Young and just beginning: Pierre
results.brief_description: Focuses on Pierre Quinn, a young French-Canadian boy from Hauterive, Quebec, as he trains and performs along with other young dancers at the National Ballet School of Canada. When the school began, there were no male students but now of the 147 student one quarter are male. Theis change in attitude toward the male dancer was influenced to a great extent by Nuryev and Baryshnikov.

results.title: Young airmen: new strength for the RAAF
results.brief_description: The training of 16-year-old men as radio engineers at Melbourne Technical College. This info-documentary highlights the training and education of young men to join the air force. They are trained in radio, morse code and other techniques to allow them to detect enemy planes in darkness. “Radio technology is the tool of the future for communication” (1950). Photography: Geoff Thompson.
